title: What is the answer to (a+3) (a+3)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Remember that [math](a+b)c=ac+bc[/math], for any [math]a,b[/math] and [math]c[/math]. So, we have [math]{(a+b)}^2=a^2+2ab+b^2[/math], for any [math]a[/math] and [math]b[/math]. Proof : [math]{(a+b)}^2=(a+b)(a+b)[/math] [math]=a(a+b)+b(a+b)[/math] [math]=a^2+ab+ba+b^2[/math] [math]=a^2+ab+ab+b^2[/math] [math]=a^2+2ab+b^2[/math] So, we can see that [math](a+3)(a+3)=a^2+2\cdot a\cdot 3+3^2[/math] [math](a+3)(a+3)=a^2+6a+9[/math]

Q; (a+3)(a+3)=?? SOLUTION;= (a+3)(a+3) = (a+3)^2 NOW USING ALGEBRA WHOLE SQUARE FORMULA (X+Y)^2 =X^2 +Y^2 +2XY THEREFORE,(a+3)(a+3) = (a+3)^2 = a^2 + 3^2 +2(a)(3) (a+3)(a+3)=(a+3)^2 =a^2 +9+6a ( which is a answer of that given question)
